TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE , following the introduction of preliminary investigations against the applicant on account of money laundering ( Geldwäsche ) , ORG ordered the seizure of MONEY .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG introduced a formal accusation against the applicant and CARDINAL others , including her former partner . The applicant was accused of having committed in DATE and DATE by one and the same act ( GPE ) money laundering and accessory after the fact ( Begünstigung ) .

CARDINAL . Thereafter the applicant ’s legal counsel , who had been jointly accused , resisted his exclusion as defence counsel . On DATE , following decisions of ORG and ORG ( this court had already rendered a similar judgment in a parallel case in DATE ) , ORG rejected his appeal . A request to ORG for interim protection was also to no avail . On DATE the files were returned to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s new legal counsel requested access to the files , which was granted .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided , on the basis of the accusation , to open the trial against the applicant and three coaccused .
CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE the applicant ’s lawyer requested a subsequent hearing pursuant to LAW see “ Relevant domestic law ” below ) .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE the applicant ’s counsel opposed both accusations . As regards the opening of the trial on account of money laundering , he submitted that at the time of the offences in question the applicant ’s acts were not yet punishable .

CARDINAL . By further letters dated DATE , CARDINAL and DATE , DATE and DATE he again opposed the accusation on legal grounds ( no fair hearing , no legal ground for the accusation ) and found that , on account of this , the main proceedings had not yet been validly opened and that therefore no hearing could be scheduled .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG separated the proceedings against CARDINAL of the then CARDINAL co - accused , including those of the applicant . On DATE the court informed the applicant ’s legal counsel that the decision to open the trial could not be challenged . It also informed him that , even though he had been heard sufficiently in the meantime , it would decide on his numerous respective motions .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s appeal against ORG inactivity regarding her motion under LAW ) of LAW .

CARDINAL . Thereafter a new dispute arose on account of the fact that the applicant ’s first legal counsel also wanted to defend her former partner . The files again had to be transferred to ORG and ORG . On DATE , after that court ’s decision of CARDINAL DATE , the files were returned to ORG
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s ( new ) legal counsel again referred to his motion of DATE and requested the court to further the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again joined the proceedings . On DATE it scheduled CARDINAL hearings to take place DATE and DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s legal counsel again referred to his motion of DATE . On DATE ORG cancelled all hearings . On DATE it scheduled CARDINAL hearings to take place from DATE .
CARDINAL . By a decision of DATE ORG again separated the proceedings against inter alia the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG refused to admit the constitutional complaint as it had been introduced out of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG , by reference to the accusation dated DATE , refused to open criminal proceedings against the applicant . It found that in so far as she was accused of money laundering , her acts were not yet punishable at the relevant time ( since the relevant provision of the German Criminal Code had only been amended thereafter ) and that , as regards the accusation of accessory after the fact , criminal prosecution was now time - barred .

In reads as follows : “ If the court , in a decision detrimental to a participant , used facts or evidentiary conclusions in respect of which he has not yet been heard and if he is not entitled to lodge a complaint against this decision or to any other legal remedy , the court shall give this participant a subsequent hearing , as far as the detriment still exists , either of proprio motu or upon an application , and decide upon an application . The court may amend its decision without an application . ”

Section CARDINAL of the Code of Criminal Procedure provides that the public prosecution or the courts may discontinue the proceedings at any stage if the perpetrator ’s culpability is considered to be insignificant and if there is no public interest in the prosecution .
According to this provision , the court may terminate the proceedings by an order made outside the main hearing where a procedural impediment arises after the main proceedings have been opened .
